title: Unknown Error at torch/lib/THC/THCGeneral.c:66
body_html:
My environment is Linux Mint 18.
I followed the tutorial to install Pytorch using virtualenv with python 3.5 and CUDA 8 support.
When I have installed I followed the "autograd" examples in tutorials it was ok.
After a while(watch Youtube videos and other stuff), when I try :
x = Variable(torch.ones(2,2))
It outputs:
THCudaCheck FAIL file=/b/wheel/pytorch-src/torch/lib/THC/THCGeneral.c line=66 error=30 : unknown error
after I reboot my computer or reinstall PyTorch the problem still exists, but when I execute:
import tensorflow as tf
The cuda messages appear and seems fine.
My Nvidia SMI results:
`
Sun May 7 22:26:10 2017
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 375.39 Driver Version: 375.39 |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU Name Persistence-M| Bus-Id Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan Temp Perf Pwr:Usage/Cap| Memory-Usage | GPU-Util Compute M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
| 0 GeForce GTX 960M Off | 0000:01:00.0 Off | N/A |
| N/A 40C P8 N/A / N/A | 251MiB / 2000MiB | 6% Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes: GPU Memory |
| GPU PID Type Process name Usage |
|=============================================================================|
| 0 2928 G /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg 152MiB |
| 0 4383 G cinnamon 34MiB |
| 0 5725 G nvidia-settings 0MiB |
| 0 6066 G ...s-passed-by-fd --v8-snapshot-passed-by-fd 61MiB |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
`

I have no clue what's wrong.

body:
My environment is Linux Mint 18.
I followed the tutorial to install Pytorch using virtualenv with python 3.5 and CUDA 8 support.
When I have installed I followed the "autograd" examples in tutorials it was ok.
After a while(watch Youtube videos and other stuff), when I try :
`
x =  Variable(torch.ones(2,2))
`
It outputs:
`
THCudaCheck FAIL file=/b/wheel/pytorch-src/torch/lib/THC/THCGeneral.c line=66 error=30 : unknown error
`
after I reboot my computer or reinstall PyTorch the problem still exists, but when I execute:
`
import tensorflow as tf
`
The cuda messages appear and seems fine.
My Nvidia SMI results:
`
Sun May  7 22:26:10 2017       
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 375.39                 Driver Version: 375.39                    |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  GeForce GTX 960M    Off  | 0000:01:00.0     Off |                  N/A |
| N/A   40C    P8    N/A /  N/A |    251MiB /  2000MiB |      6%      Default |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
                                                                               
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                       GPU Memory |
|  GPU       PID  Type  Process name                               Usage      |
|=============================================================================|
|    0      2928    G   /usr/lib/xorg/Xorg                             152MiB |
|    0      4383    G   cinnamon                                        34MiB |
|    0      5725    G   nvidia-settings                                  0MiB |
|    0      6066    G   ...s-passed-by-fd --v8-snapshot-passed-by-fd    61MiB |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
`

I have no clue what's wrong.
